revised_title: Oxygen and Extra Lines in Helium Stars Spectra
tldr: The author compares the extra lines in the spectra of helium stars with the spectrum of oxygen, suggesting that these lines may be due to oxygen. The study also provides a summary of the spectra of southern stars to the 3.5 magnitude and their distribution, finding that stars with more advanced spectra are evenly distributed in space, while stars with more recent spectra are more concentrated in the galactic zones.
